sub_title: Project Manager | Public Speaker | Pharmaceutical Industry | Event Organizer | Networking
summary:
With experience in R&D and Manufacturing, I use my research and the analytical skills to create international and collaborative teams and build reliable relationships inside a variety of fields. Along my professional life I developed the ability to manage multidisciplinary projects always keeping a result driven mindset and delivering as promised. 

My multitasking and pragmatic nature allowed me to accumulate experience in coordinating documentation and clinical manufacturing projects, planning, logistics and supply chain. With a strong focus and decisive nature, I am used to be involved in fire-fighting company's initiatives, reacting against the most critical topics. 

I lived in 4 different countries and I have knowledge on 6 European languages. This personal experience allowed me to have a broad view of life and different cultures and helped me to develop my people management skill and my capacity to network with people of different background, seniority levels and culture. Improving my communication and presentation skills.  

Let’s connect!

profile_positions.description:
• Manage and lead high complexity large-scale cross-functional projects between USA and EU to the start-up of the first European BMS facility.
• Identify and align interdependencies between business and technology delivery schedules as well as operational needs.
• Manage risks and issues, including leading creation of mitigation plan and/or escalation.
• Work creatively, pragmatic and analytically to solve problems and reach alignment between multiple cross functional stakeholders, while quickly adapt to the changes and manage communications at different levels in the organization.
• Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, presentations, and risk assessments.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager (Strategy Business & Operations)

company.name: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
•	End-to-end coordination for the introduction new drug substance to the operation plant and resupply batches, from the technology transfer to the final release, working with multiple stakeholders in US and different European sites.
•	Long term planner and detailed scheduler for the operational plant with a horizon of 2 year, strongly advising in resources constraints and priorities on a very competitive portfolio. 
•	Single point of contact for any event stock maintenance initiative that impacts the operational plant and laboratory, comprehending consumables, resins or media powders.
•	Responsible for the risk management, communication and mitigation of projected material shortfalls for impacted clinical programs on short and long-term.
•	Support for quality, compliance, and regulatory requirements in the Operational Department. Among other activities, managing change controls, quality investigations, CAPAs and deviations.
profile_positions.title: Specialist, NPI Coordinator

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
• Leader of a project on GMP documentation according to Flawless Execution concepts. 
• Responsible for providing trainings and ensure that team members are qualified to produce, update or improve GMP documents.
• Identify the necessity of new or improved documents.
• Responsible for maintaining a strong interaction with stakeholders along the project life. 
• Ensure that milestones and deadlines are reached without delay.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead - GMP Documentation

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
•	Documentation manager and specialist, responsible for maintaining a strong interaction with stakeholders and customer at development, operations and quality to ensure a flawless process execution. 
•	Author and mentor of high quality documents, working inside and outside the clean room to ensure an accurate documentation of technical procedures and guidelines for USP, DSP and Preparations teams in the vaccines production.  
•	Responsible for activities related to the production of cGMP batches, which includes processes such as batch record review and taking escalations from cell and virus culture, purification processes, formulation & fill and in-process testing. 
•	Effective professional that works precisely, detecting and solving acute problems and communicating possible abnormalities. 
•	Responsible as area owner at the production areas and ensuring that they are according to EHS&S and compliance standards.
profile_positions.title: GMP Documentation Writer

profile_positions.description: Wereld Praatjes International is focused on the international women in The Netherlands. This volunteer organisation is run by professional women for women of all nationalities, based in the Netherlands, to tackle issues connected to working and living in this country. Our core is to create networking opportunities for International and Dutch women and we seek to build a bridge between these two groups in the long run, so that we can learn from each other and progress together.
profile_positions.title: Event Organizer - Planning Committee | Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
•	Scientist and manager in an early discovery project between 5 departments in the field of oncology.  
•	Experienced in several biological techniques for sterile 2.5D cell culturing and molecular biology to attach, detect and quantify amino acids. 
•	Experienced in several technical equipment or analysis for cell culture and material characterization, including big data analysis based on mathematical models.     
•	Coach and advisor regarding the use of technical equipment and good behavior practices. 
•	Mentor and advisor of a scientific master thesis.  

•	Biological techniques: 2D/3D sterile cell culturing, transfection, transduction, immunostaining, Ellman’s assay (amino acids detection), cytoskeletal drugs based assays, cell fixing and sterilization based on irradiation, EtOH, glutaraldehyde, filtration and stem in autoclave.
•	Specialized technical equipment or analysis: microplate reader, UV-VIS, rheometer, NMR, time-lapse of living cells, optical microscopies like: confocal, fluorescence, phase contrast, bright field, dark field and stereo and high-content image analysis based on PBBK models and traction force microscopy (Matlab based analysis with statistics included).
•	Project focus: description of cellular cytoskeletal behavior during sprouting (early stage of blood vessels formation) based on 2D/3D cell culture techniques on/in hydrogels with variated stiffness and amino acid composition. Hydrogels were designed, developed and fully characterized. Cytoskeletal organization was disrupted via drugs administration to block protein polymerization and results were followed via cellular biomarkers in live cell microscopy.
profile_positions.title: Scientist / Scientific Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Associate scientist and manager of a collaborative and multidisciplinary project between 5 departments between Brazil and Greece.
•	One year as visiting scientist in the Laboratory of Biomechanics & Biomedical Engineering - UPatras, Greece .
•	Coach and advisor regarding the use of technical equipment and guidelines regulations.
•	Member of evaluation committees of 2 final scientific projects and 1 best paper award. 
•	Author of (non)scientific documents and project reports. Lecturer as biomaterials specialist in chemical engineering conference.  

•	Biological techniques: 2D/3D sterile cell culture, cell culture in bioreactor, chromatography, immunostaining, multiparametric cytotoxicity assay, organic/biomolecular chemistry reactions, histology, cell fixing and sterilizations.
•	Specialized technical equipment or analysis: mass spectrometer (MS), FTIR, thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA), differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), spectrophotometer, microtomography (µCT), optical microscopies like: confocal, fluorescence, phase contrast, bright field, dark field and stereo and statistical analysis.
•	Project focus: design and development of 3D culture techniques in a closed bioreactor under physiological conditions. Cells grew in a polymeric biomaterial modified via chemistry reactions in order to get different chemical compounds in the interface biomaterial-human adhesive protein. I participated in the design/operational project of the bioreactor and developed the methodology to work with it.
profile_positions.title: Associate Scientist / Laboratory Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	People and time management professional in a collaborative project between 2  departments in different fields.
•	Coordinator of 8 professionals with different backgrounds and seniority levels, aligning experiments and deadlines and establishing working rules and timetables.  
•	Responsibility in the maintenance of in-stock personal protective equipment, chemicals, laboratory supplies and technical equipment. 
•	Author of (non)scientific documents and project reports and conference lecturer.

•	Biological techniques: 2D sterile cell culturing, isolation of human primary cells, immunostaining, organic/biomolecular chemistry reactions, crystal violet (color-change chemistry), cell fixing and sterilization based on EtO, EtOH, glutaraldehyde and stem in autoclave. 
•	Specialized technical equipment or analysis: infrared and x-ray spectroscopy, spectrophotometer, thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA), differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), contact angle, atomic force microscope (AFM), scanning electronic microscope (SEM) and optical microscopes like: fluorescence, phase contrast, bright field, dark field and stereo.
•	Project focus: design and development of polymeric biomaterials for tissue engineering. Host response modulation via chemistry reactions produced different compounds in the interface biomaterial-human adhesive protein. Full characterization with respect to structure and compositions. Cytotoxicity assays validated the materials based on cellular biomarkers.
profile_positions.title: Ressearch assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Laboratory trained personnel that worked between materials department and institute of biomedical sciences. 
•	Responsibilities related to read and write reports and protocols, run research protocols (experimental and equipment related), reach the deadlines, generate and maintain results data, safely deal with chemical/biological agents or wasting products and follow laboratory guidelines in compliance with GLP and EHS regulations.
•	Experienced lots of techniques related to biomaterials production, cell culturing and molecular biology, e.g. 2D cell culturing (i.e. basic care, expansion, use, destruction, freeze and fix), ELISA, SDS-PAGE, media and reagents preparation, immunostaining and sterilization based on EtOH, glutaraldehyde and stem in autoclave.
profile_positions.title: Intership in scientific research

profile_positions.description:
•	 Self management visiting researcher in the Laboratory of Biomechanics & Biomedical Engineering.
•	Responsible for the development of alternative in vivo methods protocols in the field of tissue engineering and wound care. Actively participated in the design/operational project of the bioreactor and developed the methodology for sterile work.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Coach groups of up to 14 people, with different levels of knowledge and strength, to develop the necessary skills to excel at acrobatics.
Main tasks were not only related to skills development, but also to managing the group with a strong attention to each personal assignment, helping with self confidence improvement and making such a diverse group work as a team.
profile_positions.title: Acrobatic dance coach
